forumNotes.author: laddanator
forumNotes.content:
I am using a CD version of my Boot USB stuff. I have trouble sometimes with new and old computers booting to USB so I made a tag file and put it on the root of my USB Stick so that I could set root to the USB from the CD but not sure how to hook the USB drive that I am passing the torch to from the CD? I get an error if I try to install XP from the USB this way. The error states it can't find bios info but if I boot straight from the USB stick or hard drive, all works fine. Windows 7 and Vista work fine with this method and pretty much everything else but XP. The CD thing is just a plan b if the USB will not boot.  

My question is how to apply the hook command or is that the command I need to hook the USB device?

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
How do you create XP USB install part?  
Which XP files exist at USB drive?  

Which menu.lst do you use at CD and USB drive?  

Long shot:  
map USB drive as hd0

forumNotes.author: laddanator
forumNotes.content:
I use Winsetuptousb here for the XP part and it works great. I customize it allot to fit my needs but the base is great [http://www.msfn.org/.../page__st__1540](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/120444-how-to-install-windows-from-usb-winsetupfromusb-with-gui/page__st__1540 "External link") CD menu.lst: ``` timeout 15 default /default color white/blue title Boot From Hard Drive (Windows Vista/7/2008 or Xp)n find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /bootmgr || find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /ntldr || rootnoverify (hd0) && chainloader +1 && boot map () (hd0) && map (hd0) () && map --rehook find --set-root --devices=h /bootmgr || find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /ntldr chainloader /bootmgr || chainloader /ntldr title root title 01. Partition Wizard 7.0nGreat Partitioning Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 02. Hiren's BootCD 15.1nGreat DOS Programs find --set-root /CD.tag map --mem /HBCD/Dos/dos.gz (fd0) map --hook chainloader (fd0)+1 rootnoverify (fd0) map --floppies=1 title root title 03. Image for Linux 2.66nBackup...Restore...Ghosting Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 04. KillDisc Pro DOS 4.1nGet Rid Of The Tough Come Back Virus password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 05. Memtest86+ V4.20nReally Great Memory Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 06. Mini Windows XpnCopy Data From An Infected Computer. Take Premissions And More password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag chainloader /HBCD/XP/XP.BIN title root title 07. Nod32 5 Rescue Disc (Jump Drive Must Be Plugged In)nUpdated 12-11-11.!576 Or More Ram Required! password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /bootmgr title root title 08. Other Useful Tools (Jump Drive Must Be Plugged In)nPassword, Partitioning Tools And Lots More find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag configfile /hbcd.lst title root title 09. Seagate For DOS 2.23 (If You Need Non-Graphical Interface Use Hiren's)nGreat Hard Drive Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 10. Windows Password RemovernXP-VISTA-WINDOWS 7 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 11. Plop Boot ManagernBoot Computers With No USB Support password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag kernel /plpbt.bin title root title 12. Mini7..Can Use To Test But Still Buggy password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /HBCD/7/7.BIN title root title 13. Superman XP PRO CORPn My Use Only password --md5 $1$0$NtEZSDZZ3Hjh6lV5xYzmT/ map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook ls /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO || find --set-root --ignore-cd /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO map /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO (0xff) || map --mem /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO (0xff) savedefault 2 checkrange 0x00,0x01 read 0x8280 && configfile /BOOTWS/fd.lst checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot title menu separator title -------------------- Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 Installers -------------------- root title Options 1-6 root title root title 01. XP Setup With MOST Driver(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nOctobor 2011 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. # find the ISO folder by looking for a marker file debug off find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag clear echo # list all files in the /WINSETUP folder so the user can see them ls ()/WINSETUP/ISO/ echo # Ask user which iso they want (name is converted to uppercase as /u is specified) set /p /u install=Enter XP Filename WITH NO .ISO EXTENSION. (ex.HOME ) : if "%install%"=="" echo No iso file specified! && configfile /menu.lst clear # check if user entered a valid filename with no ISO extension! ls /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso || echo Cannot find /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso !!! && pause --wait=3 && configfile (bd)/menu.lst echo Loading /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso - please wait ... #set root drive to USB stick find --set-root /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso # run the grub4dos map command and specify the iso file we want to load map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook ls /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso || find --set-root --ignore-cd /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso map /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso (0xff) || map --mem /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso (0xff) savedefault 2 checkrange 0x00,0x01 read 0x8280 && configfile /BOOTWS/fd.lst checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot title root title 02. Windows Vista SP2 Setup(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nOctober 2011 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map --mem /BOOTMGR (rd) write --offset=0x105E (rd)+1 xEBx08 write --offset=0x54696 (rd)+1 4 chainloader (rd)+1 root () title root title 03. Windows 7 SP1 x32 Setup(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nNovember 2011. password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map --mem /BOOTMGR (rd) write --offset=0x105E (rd)+1 xEBx08 write --offset=0x54696 (rd)+1 2 chainloader (rd)+1 root () title root title 04. Windows 7 SP1 x64 Setup(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nNovember 2011. password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map --mem /BOOTMGR (rd) write --offset=0x105E (rd)+1 xEBx08 write --offset=0x54696 (rd)+1 1 chainloader (rd)+1 root () title root title 05. Windows 8 Beta Setup(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nTesting Only password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map --mem /BOOTMGR (rd) write --offset=0x105E (rd)+1 xEBx08 write --offset=0x54696 (rd)+1 6 chainloader (rd)+1 root () title root title 06. Windows Vista, 7 Repair Console(Must Have Jump Drive Plugged In)nPassword Removale Tools And Much More password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /bootmgr title root title Ladd's BootUSB ChangeLog pager on find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag cat /LaddsBootChanges.txt boot title root title root title Reboot reboot ```
USB menu.lst ``` timeout 15 default /default color white/blue title 01. Partition Wizard 7.0nGreat Partitioning Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 02. Boot From Hard Drive (Windows Vista/7 or Xp)nBoot Into Main OS Drive map (hd0) (hd1) map (hd1) (hd0) map --hook chainloader (hd0)+1 rootnoverify (hd0) title root title Hiren's BootCD (Will Not Boot From This NTFS Drive. Use The Fat32 Drive)n root title root title 03. Image for Linux 2.66nBackup...Restore...Ghosting Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 04. KillDisc Pro DOS 4.1nGet Rid Of The Tough Come Back Virus password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 05. Memtest86+ V4.20nReally Great Memory Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 06. Mini Windows XpnCopy Data From An Infected Computer. Take Premissions And More password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /HBCD/XP/XP.BIN title root title 07. Nod32 5 Rescue Disc (Only Use If MiniXP Can't Find Hard Drive)nUpdated 12-11-11.!576 Or More Ram Required! password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /bootmgr title root title 08. Other Useful Tools(When All The Others Fail, Try This)nPassword, Partitioning Tools And Lots More find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag configfile /hbcd.lst title root title 09. Seagate For DOS 2.23 (If You Need Non-Graphical Interface Use Hiren's)nGreat Hard Drive Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 10. Windows Password RemovernXP-VISTA-WINDOWS 7 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag map /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 11. Plop Boot ManagernBoot Computers With No USB Support password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag kernel /plpbt.bin title root title 12. Mini7..Can Use To Test But Still Buggy password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /HBCD/7/7.BIN title root title 13. Superman XP PRO CORPn My Use Only password --md5 $1$0$NtEZSDZZ3Hjh6lV5xYzmT/ map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook ls /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO || find --set-root --ignore-cd /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO map /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO (0xff) || map --mem /WINSETUP/PROC.ISO (0xff) savedefault 2 checkrange 0x00,0x01 read 0x8280 && configfile /BOOTWS/fd.lst checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot title menu separator title -------------------- Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 Installers -------------------- root title Options 1-6 root title root title 01. (ex.HOME ) : if "%install%"=="" echo No iso file specified! && configfile /menu.lst clear # check if user entered a valid filename with no ISO extension! ls /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso || echo Cannot find /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso !!! && pause --wait=3 && configfile (bd)/menu.lst echo Loading /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso - please wait ... #set root drive to USB stick find --set-root /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso # run the grub4dos map command and specify the iso file we want to load map --unmap=0:0xff map --unhook ls /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso || find --set-root --ignore-cd /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso map /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso (0xff) || map --mem /WINSETUP/ISO/%install%.iso (0xff) savedefault 2 checkrange 0x00,0x01 read 0x8280 && configfile /BOOTWS/fd.lst checkrange 8 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/8.lst checkrange 7 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/7.lst checkrange 6 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/6.lst checkrange 5 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/5.lst checkrange 4 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/4.lst checkrange 3 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/3.lst checkrange 2 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/2.lst checkrange 1 calc *0x475 & 0xFF && configfile /BOOTWS/1.lst boot title root title 02. Windows Vista SP2 SetupnOctober 2011 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. map --mem /BOOTMGR (rd) write --offset=0x105E (rd)+1 xEBx08 write --offset=0x54696 (rd)+1 4 chainloader (rd)+1 root () title root title 03. Windows Vista, 7 Repair ConsolenPassword Removale Tools And Much More password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag chainloader /bootmgr title root title Ladd's BootUSB ChangeLog pager on find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag cat /LaddsBootChanges.txt boot title root title root title Reboot reboot ```
As you can see I use /laddsbootusb.tag from the CD to find the root of my USB. Like I said all works fine except the XP part. I think the bios doesnt know that USB is being used instead of CD at this point.

forumNotes.author: laddanator
forumNotes.content:
So I fixed it and working so far. I changed the above CD menu.lst to this New CD menu.lst ``` timeout 15 default /default color white/blue title Boot From Hard Drive (Windows Vista/7/2008 or Xp)n find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /bootmgr || find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /ntldr || rootnoverify (hd0) && chainloader +1 && boot map () (hd0) && map (hd0) () && map --rehook find --set-root --devices=h /bootmgr || find --set-root --ignore-floppies --ignore-cd /ntldr chainloader /bootmgr || chainloader /ntldr title root title 01. Partition Wizard 7.0nGreat Partitioning Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/PWHE7.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 02. Hiren's BootCD 15.1nGreat DOS Programs password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map --mem /HBCD/Dos/dos.gz (fd0) map --hook chainloader (fd0)+1 rootnoverify (fd0) map --floppies=1 title root title 03. Image for Linux 2.66nBackup...Restore...Ghosting Tool password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/IFL.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 04. KillDisc Pro DOS 4.1nGet Rid Of The Tough Come Back Virus password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/KD.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 05. Memtest86+ V4.20nReally Great Memory Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/MT420.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 06. Mini Windows XpnCopy Data From An Infected Computer. Take Premissions And More password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag chainloader /HBCD/XP/XP.BIN title root title 07. Seagate For DOS 2.23 (If You Need Non-Graphical Interface Use Hiren's)nGreat Hard Drive Tester password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/SEAGATE2.3.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 08. Windows Password RemovernXP-VISTA-WINDOWS 7 password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag map /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) || map --mem /IMAGES/WLR.ISO (hd32) map --hook chainloader (hd32) title root title 09. Plop Boot ManagernBoot Computers With No USB Support password --md5 $1$A$hzYlFap3SLNNQ/tA7c3.S. find --set-root /CD.tag kernel /plpbt.bin title root title menu separator title ------------Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 Installers And Rescue Tools -------------------- root title root [b]title 10. For XP, Vista, Windows 7, and Other Rescue ToolsnPlease Have Jump Drive Plugged In find --set-root /laddsbootusb.tag configfile /menu.lst[/b] title root title root title title Reboot reboot ```
Changed the Bold Test to just call the menu.lst from the USB drive and XP is installing fine. Plop locks up on my allot so I wanted to boot the USB from CD as plan b. Most all computers boot from CD fine but even new stuff will not boot to USB sometimes.
